channel.title: Looping through inventory

item.title: Looping through inventory
item.dc:creator: @iz3_legend iz3 legend
item.description:
@iz3_legend wrote:

for (int j : Config.ITEMS) {
     while (playerHasItem(j, c.getItems().getItemAmount(j)) {
          c.getItems().deleteItem(j, c.getItems().getItemAmount(j));
     }
}

Read full topic

item.title: Looping through inventory
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

Vain_:

just use the boolean playerHasItem(int,int) or w.e it is on your server.

Tried that too

[code=java]

for (int j : Config.ITEMS) {

if (playerHasItem(j, 1))
c.getItems().deleteItem(j, c.getItems().getItemAmount(j));

}

Still doesn’t properly delete them on death.[/code]

Are you going for specific or all?
[/quote]

for (int j : Config.ITEMS) {

Specific, that should count for all that are in the array[/quote]
Shit, I thought that was Config.ITEM_LIMIT lol…

Try changing j to Config.max or what ever you describe the max number for an int as…

item.title: Looping through inventory
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

Trying to remove certain items on death. How come this isn’t working?

	for (int i : Config.ITEMS) {
		for (int i1 = 0; i1 < 28; i1++) {
			if (c.playerItems[i1] == i)
			c.getItems().deleteItem(i, c.getItems().getItemAmount(i));
		}
	}
	
	
	for (int j : Config.ITEMS) {
		for (int k = 0; k < c.playerEquipment.length; k++) {
			
			if (c.playerEquipment[k] == j) {
				c.getItems().deleteEquipment(j, c.playerWeapon);
			}
		
		}
	}

	
	c.sendMessage("@red@Your items disappear as you die.");

I think it works for equipment, but the inventory items aren’t being removed on death.

Read full topic
